name: Quickblog WP Blog Exporter
author: Quickblog

sections.description:
Quickblog’s Plugin for WordPress allows site owners to very quickly and easily export all of their blog posts to a Google Sheet, which can then be imported directly into Quickblog!

If you use Yoast SEO, your keywords and meta will be automatically exported as well!
sections.installation: Download the plugin and Activate it, simple as that!
sections.faq:
What are your operational hours for support?

Quickblog’s general support hours are Monday to Saturday, 8:00 to 20:00 GMT/BST. During this time, we can generally provide feedback on any support queries.

How do I get help?

If you’re experiencing issues, please send a ticket to help@quickblog.co with “Error” in the subject line. Please send as much information as possible, including which links you’re experiencing problems with, any error messages and screenshots/videos if possible.

Do you offer a free trial?

Quickblog has a Forever Free account, so you can store multiple blog posts

What features are included in the Forever Free account?

With Quickblog’s Forever Free account, you can store multiple blog posts. You won’t have access to sub-accounts, scheduling, blog search bar, imports or the Shopify integration, or Google Import, so if you want all of these features, you will need to upgrade to a Premium or Agency account.

What if I have any other questions?

Please reach out to us at help@quickblog.co for any queries!
sections.changelog:
1.4.0

  • Logo URL.
  • Removed WordPress markup tags.
  • Acciom details added.

1.4.4

  • Fixed Google sheet export bug.

short_description: Exports existing WordPress blog posts to Google Sheets
description:
Quickblog’s Plugin for WordPress allows site owners to very quickly and easily export all of their blog posts to a Google Sheet, which can then be imported directly into Quickblog!

If you use Yoast SEO, your keywords and meta will be automatically exported as well!

upgrade_notice.1.4.0: Most stable version. Bugs with WP markup tags removed

screenshots.caption: The Quickblog Exporter Plugin UI. Simply enter your Google Sheet URL (anyone with the link MUST have Editor access) and the Sheet/Tab name (e.g. Sheet1) and click Export and all of your posts will be exported to the Google Sheet.
An example of 1 post being exported to Google Sheets!
